text: The Dr. Cleo Miller House, also known as Ivy Hall, is a historic mansion in Nashville, Tennessee, U.S.. It was designed and built during 1934–1936. With . It is approximately in plan. It was designed by Edwin A. Keeble in Tudor Revival architectural style. It was the residence of Dr. Cleo Miller, a college friend of Keeble's at Vanderbilt University. The house has been listed on the National Register of Historic Places since August 25, 1995. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Tennessee Category:Tudor Revival architecture in Tennessee Category:Houses completed in 1936 Category:Houses in Nashville, Tennessee
title: Dr. Cleo Miller House
